input.rev_rec_notes: Capacity commitment is invoiced annually in advance (ramp by contract year) but is a prepaid consumption right - revenue recognized as credits are consumed. Overage/storage are billed monthly in arrears and recognized as-used. Services are milestone-based (kickoff + go-live).
input.use_case_description: Snowflake signs a 3-year enterprise Order Form for the Snowflake AI Data Cloud modeled as a capacity commitment (prepaid consumption credits) with an annual ramp and an on-demand overage rate once the committed balance is exhausted. Create a Subscription with a Ramp (or three annual segments) for the Capacity Commitment rate plan: Year 1 committed spend $750,000 billed annually in advance; Year 2 $1,250,000 billed annually in advance; Year 3 $2,000,000 billed annually in advance (all demo pricing). Treat the committed spend as a prepaid drawdown balance that is relieved as usage occurs, using usage imports (e.g., credits consumed) to drive recognition rather than straight-line over the year. Add a separate Usage charge for Overage Consumption billed monthly in arrears at $5.75 per credit once the committed credit balance is depleted (and/or for usage explicitly classified as overage), with invoices generated monthly based on usage records. Optionally include metered storage as a separate usage component at $30 per TB-month billed monthly in arrears (kept separate from the committed credit pool for demo clarity). Include a Professional Services rate plan for implementation/migration/training sold alongside the commit as a fixed-fee SOW: $200,000 total, invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live, with the commercial intent that services support adoption of the platform during Year 1. Apply a negotiated bundle discount of 10% off list across the committed spend and services to force allocation in revenue (allocate discount across POBs using list prices as SSP proxies). Revenue expectation (inferred): committed capacity is recognized as the customer consumes credits (release from deferred as-used); overage and storage are recognized as-used/as-billed in the monthly period; services are recognized as delivered (over time or at milestone depending on SOW acceptance criteria).

hints: "Billing Period: Annually" and "billed annually in advance" (commit) → billing_period=Year, billing_timing=InAdvance
"capacity commitment (prepaid consumption credits)" and "committed spend" → MIN COMMIT + PREPAID DRAWDOWN
"usage imports (credits consumed) to drive recognition" and "release from deferred as-used" → USAGE + ADVANCED CONSUMPTION + CUSTOM EVENT
"annual ramp" with Year 1/2/3 committed spend steps → RAMP
"on-demand overage rate" and "once the committed balance is exhausted" → OVERAGE
"invoiced 50% at kickoff and 50% at go-live" → TIERED PRICING (milestone-style invoicing)
"negotiated bundle discount of 10%" and "allocate discount across POBs" → DISCOUNT + BUNDLE + ALLOCATION

subscription.name: Snowflake AI Data Cloud - 3YR Capacity Commit (PPDD) + PS (Demo)

assumptions: Because serviceEnd was not specified, subscriptionEndDate is derived from the authoritative termMonths=36: 2026-01-01 through 2029-01-01.

The 10% negotiated bundle discount is modeled via sellPrice = 90% of listPrice on (a) the three annual capacity prepayment segments and (b) both PS milestone charges; usage (overage/storage) remains undiscounted for demo clarity.

Committed credits are represented as prepaid balance units (UOM=Credit) created by each annual prepayment segment (Year 1: 150,000; Year 2: 250,000; Year 3: 400,000). This implies a demo conversion of $5.00 list per credit for the committed pool solely to define units.
Committed consumption is imported as usage against the Drawdown charge; it is intended to deplete the prepaid unit balance and drive revenue recognition in ZR rather than straight-line over the year.
Overage usage is either (a) produced only after the committed credit balance is depleted, or (b) flagged/classified as overage and imported directly to the Overage Consumption charge.
Metered Storage is intentionally kept separate from the committed credit pool (separate UOM and charge) to simplify demo reporting and rev rec treatment.
Allocations are required and should be performed using list price as SSP proxy across the capacity commitment deliverables and professional services deliverables.
open_questions: What is the contractual definition (and date) of Go-Live? If known, should the Go-Live PS charge use a specificTriggerDate and/or a specific revenue event date?

Should committed drawdown generate $0 invoices (usage tracked only) or generate invoices that are automatically offset/applied against prepaid balance? (This impacts Billing operations but not the conceptual PPDD revenue intent.)
Is there an agreed contractual conversion between $ commitment and credits (i.e., the committed credits entitlement), or is the commitment purely dollar-based with variable effective $/credit?
Should overage and/or storage be eligible for allocation, or treated as variable consideration excluded from initial allocation?

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Consumption Ratable with VC upon booking
charge_pob_map.rationale: Annual prepaid capacity rights are established at booking; revenue is intended to be recognized as the customer consumes committed credits during the contract year.

alternatives.pob_name: Consumption Ratable without VC upon booking
alternatives.why_not: Use if you do not need VC-style consumption-driven release logic in your ZR configuration; some PPDD implementations prefer this when consumption valuation is fixed.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Consumption Ratable with VC upon booking
charge_pob_map.rationale: Year-2 ramp creates a new annual prepaid capacity tranche whose satisfaction pattern is consumption-based within Year 2.

alternatives.pob_name: Consumption Ratable without VC upon booking
alternatives.why_not: Same consideration as Year 1; depends on how your ZR PPDD/consumption valuation is configured.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Consumption Ratable with VC upon booking
charge_pob_map.rationale: Year-3 ramp creates the final prepaid capacity tranche; revenue is expected to follow consumption during the final contract year.

alternatives.pob_name: Consumption Ratable without VC upon booking

charge_pob_map.rationale: Usage imports represent consumption of committed credits and should drive the consumption/satisfaction pattern; commonly used as the event driver for PPDD release logic.

alternatives.why_not: Use if your ZR configuration expects the USAGE_QTY release event specifically (rather than a generic consumption usage event template).

charge_pob_map.rationale: Overage is billed monthly in arrears from usage records and should be recognized in the billed/usage period as non-committed consumption.

alternatives.why_not: Use if you want recognition driven directly by usage/consumption events rather than invoice/billing release timing.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Storage is a separate metered usage component billed monthly in arrears and recognized as-used/as-billed in the monthly period.

alternatives.why_not: Use if you prefer usage-event-based (non-billing) release for storage instead of billed release.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Kickoff milestone is billed and delivered at the start; recognize point-in-time aligned to the milestone/start-date billing.

alternatives.why_not: Use if you want the milestone released upon booking rather than upon billing (depends on contract setup and ZR policy).

charge_pob_map.rationale: Go-live milestone is satisfied upon completion/go-live; recognize point-in-time when the completion event is recorded (and typically billed).

alternatives.why_not: Use if the SOW defines formal customer acceptance (rather than internal completion) as the revenue trigger.
Use if go-live revenue should be recognized strictly when invoiced (billing-driven) rather than event-driven.

mapping_notes: PPDD intent: The annual Capacity Commitment Prepayment charges are the primary POBs for committed capacity rights, with recognition pattern driven by consumption (not straight-line). The Drawdown usage charge is mapped to a consumption usage template to support usage-driven release logic.

Allocation intent: Because the committed capacity and PS are discounted (sellPrice < listPrice), ZR allocation should spread the total discount across those POBs using listPrice as the SSP proxy (per the stated Allocation Method: Use List Price).
Overage/Storage intent: These are billed monthly in arrears and mapped to BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO to recognize in the billed period; treat as non-allocated variable usage for demo simplicity.
Services intent: Milestone-based recognition—kickoff recognized at start-date billing; go-live recognized upon completion/go-live event (or acceptance if contractually required).

assumptions: ContractEffective date is assumed to be 2026-01-01 (same as Service Start, Booking Date, and provided Go-Live Date).
Annual ramp prepayment charges are assumed to have effective dates on each anniversary and therefore invoice on 2026-01-01, 2027-01-01, and 2028-01-01 (annual billing in advance).

The negotiated bundle discount (10% off list) is applied as net pricing directly on the committed prepayment charges and the Professional Services milestone charges (i.e., billed amounts = list * 0.90).
No discount is applied to overage or metered storage usage charges (not explicitly included in the discount scope).
No proration is required because the subscription term (2026-01-01 to 2029-01-01) aligns exactly to annual segments and monthly usage periods start on the 1st.
Usage-based charges are shown with monthly billing periods in arrears (billing date = last day of each month) and Amount/Quantity set to 0 because actual usage imports were not provided.

The 'Committed Credit Consumption (Drawdown)' usage charge is assumed to be rated at $0.00 per credit and used to track consumption/drawdown; actual reduction of the prepaid balance is assumed to be handled by the PPDD/prepaid balance configuration rather than generating net-new billed revenue.
open_questions: Go-Live milestone billing: is the Go-Live date really 2026-01-01 (which causes both 50% milestones to invoice on day 1), or should Go-Live occur later?
Do you want the three annual ramp prepayments billed on each anniversary (as modeled), or all upfront at ContractEffective on 2026-01-01?
Should the 10% bundle discount be modeled as separate Discount charge lines (instead of net prices) for invoicing clarity?
Should the $0 drawdown usage charge be invoiceable (as shown) or non-billable (record usage only, no invoice items)?
Confirm whether Metered Storage is in-scope (included as optional in the notes) or should be excluded from the subscription.

zr_contracts_orders.Subscription Name: Snowflake AI Data Cloud - 3YR Capacity Commit (PPDD) + PS (Demo)
Snowflake AI Data Cloud - 3YR Capacity Commit (PPDD) + PS (Demo)

Snowflake AI Data Cloud - 3YR Capacity Commit (PPDD) + PS (Demo)

assumptions: A 10% negotiated bundle discount is applied to the fixed consideration components only (Capacity Commitment Prepayment Years 1–3 and Professional Services milestones). Usage-based charges (drawdown, overage, storage) are excluded from the upfront allocation because the consideration is variable and determined from usage/invoicing.
SSP is proxied by List Price for all allocation-eligible lines (per 'Allocation Method: Use List Price'). Therefore Ext SSP Price equals Ext List Price for those lines.

The allocation is performed using standard relative SSP across allocation-eligible lines at contract inception; ramp averaging is not applied because each annual prepayment segment is treated as a distinct POB/annual credit pool for demo purposes.

Professional Services milestone revenue start/end is set to the milestone date (same-day recognition) because no separate service delivery period was provided; both milestones are dated 2026-01-01 based on the provided Go-Live Date and Booking Date.

Usage charges are modeled with Ordered Qty = 0 at order creation; monthly invoices and revenue recognition will be driven by imported usage quantities (credits, TB-month) and billing events, so initial Ext List/Sell/Allocated amounts are 0.

Initial state assumption: Unreleased Revenue is set equal to Ext Allocated Price and Released Revenue is 0 for all lines (even if the POB template indicates booking/billed release). Actual releases will occur when the corresponding trigger/release events are processed in Zuora Revenue.
Revenue end dates provided (e.g., 2027-01-01 for Year 1) are treated as end-exclusive boundaries consistent with common subscription conventions.
open_questions: The Capacity Commitment Prepayment POB template provided indicates 'Upon Booking (Full Booking Release)'. Should the prepayment instead be treated as deferred and recognized only upon usage drawdown (i.e., a liability/deferred revenue relief driven by usage), or is the provided template intentional for this demo?

Should Zuora Revenue ramp allocation (average pricing across ramp periods) be enabled for the 3-year capacity commitment, or should the three annual segments remain separately allocated/recognized as modeled here?

What is the conversion between committed spend dollars and committed consumption credits (i.e., how many credits are loaded into the prepaid balance for each year) to support the drawdown usage events?
Is Metered Storage definitively included in the order form, or is it optional and should be excluded from the subscription if not sold?
Are the Professional Services milestones both expected to occur on 2026-01-01, or is there a later Go-Live date/milestone acceptance date that should drive the EVT-PIT-COMPLETION release?
Should the 10% bundle discount also apply to overage and/or storage usage rates, or are those strictly pay-as-you-go at list?

assumptions: Revenue End Date is treated as exclusive for daily straight-line calculations (e.g., 2026-01-01 to 2027-01-01 = 365 days).

For BK-OT-CONSUMP-RATABLE-VC lines (1–3), the constrained estimate equals the provided Ext Allocated Price and no variable consideration true-ups (rip/replace adjustments) are included due to no VC inputs provided.
Professional Services - Kickoff Milestone (Line 4) is assumed billed on 2026-01-01 (contract/service start) and therefore recognized fully in Jan-26 per BL-PIT-STARTDATE instructions.

Professional Services - Go-Live Milestone (Line 5) completion event is assumed to occur on the provided Go-Live Date (2026-01-01) and therefore recognized fully in Jan-26 per EVT-PIT-COMPLETION instructions.
For event-driven usage/billing POBs with no usage/billing event data provided (Lines 6–8), revenue is shown as $0 for all periods.
open_questions: Committed Credit Consumption (Drawdown) (Line 6): Please provide consumption/usage events by month (units consumed and the applicable unit rate from the prepaid pool) so revenue can be recognized upon consumption.
Overage Consumption (PayGo) (Line 7): Please provide billing events by month (invoice/bill run dates and billed amounts) so revenue can be recognized upon billing.
Metered Storage (PayGo) (Line 8): Please provide billing events by month (invoice/bill run dates and billed amounts) so revenue can be recognized upon billing.

BK-OT-CONSUMP-RATABLE-VC (Lines 1–3): What is the initial constrained estimate vs. total consideration, and when/how does VC resolve (expected true-up periods/amounts) so we can model rip/replace adjustments?
Professional Services (Lines 4–5): Confirm the actual billing date for the kickoff invoice and the actual completion date for the go-live milestone if different from 2026-01-01.

assumptions: Commercial scope: 3-year (36-month) enterprise term running 2026-01-01 (start) to 2029-01-01 (end), with no proration required because anniversaries and monthly usage periods align to the 1st of the month.
Capacity commitment is sold as three annual ramp segments billed annually in advance on each anniversary: Year 1 invoice on 2026-01-01, Year 2 on 2027-01-01, Year 3 on 2028-01-01.

Committed capacity is treated operationally as a prepaid drawdown balance (prepaid consumption credits) that is relieved as usage occurs; revenue for committed capacity is intended to be recognized based on consumption (usage-driven release) rather than straight-line over time.

For demo modeling, each annual prepayment segment creates a prepaid credit entitlement (UOM=Credit) using an assumed $5.00 list per credit conversion to define units: Year 1 = 150,000 credits, Year 2 = 250,000 credits, Year 3 = 400,000 credits.

Committed consumption is imported as usage against a dedicated Drawdown usage charge; the Drawdown charge is assumed to be rated at $0.00 per credit and is used to track consumption/depletion (i.e., it is not intended to generate incremental billed revenue).

Overage usage is billed monthly in arrears at $5.75 per credit once committed credits are depleted and/or when usage is explicitly classified as overage; overage usage is imported directly to the Overage charge to drive monthly invoicing.

Metered storage (if included) is modeled as a separate usage charge at $30 per TB-month billed monthly in arrears, with a separate UOM and explicitly kept outside of the committed credit pool for operational and demo clarity.

Pricing/discounting: a negotiated 10% bundle discount is applied to fixed consideration only (the three annual capacity prepayment segments and both professional services milestone charges) by setting sell price to 90% of list; usage charges (drawdown/overage/storage) remain undiscounted for demo clarity.

Revenue allocation intent: allocation is required across the discounted deliverables (committed capacity + professional services) using relative SSP with List Price as the SSP proxy (Allocation Method = Use List Price); usage-based charges are treated as variable and excluded from upfront allocation for demo simplicity.

POB/template intent: annual capacity prepayment charges represent the primary committed-capacity POBs, with recognition driven by consumption; the Drawdown usage charge is mapped to a consumption usage template to support usage-driven release logic.

Overage and storage are treated as pay-as-you-go (monthly in arrears) and mapped to a billed/period-based usage template (recognize in the billed period) and shown as non-allocated variable usage for demo simplicity.

Professional services are sold as a fixed-fee SOW ($200,000 total list) with two milestones (50% kickoff, 50% go-live), discounted 10% with the bundle; recognition is milestone/event-driven (kickoff at start date; go-live at completion/go-live event).

In the absence of a separate delivery period or later go-live info, both services milestones are assumed dated 2026-01-01, resulting in same-day billing/recognition in January 2026 for both milestones under the assumed start-date and completion-event release templates.
Usage charges are created with ordered quantity = 0 at booking; invoices and revenue for usage-based components are expected to be driven entirely by imported usage and subsequent billing events.

Reporting/mechanics defaults: revenue end dates are treated as end-exclusive boundaries; initial unreleased revenue is assumed to equal the allocated amount and released revenue starts at 0 until usage/billing/milestone events are processed.
open_questions: [BLOCKING] What is the intended revenue treatment for the annual capacity prepayment lines in Zuora Revenue: should they remain deferred and be released only via drawdown/usage (as the business intent states), or should they follow the currently referenced template behavior of “Upon Booking (Full Booking Release)” (which would recognize upfront and contradict usage-based recognition intent)? (This determines the core POB template/mapping and the entire revenue schedule.)

[BLOCKING] What is the contractual conversion/entitlement between committed spend and credits (credits loaded into the prepaid balance for each year)? Is it fixed (e.g., $/credit) or dollar-based with variable effective pricing? (This is required to operationalize PPDD drawdown and to interpret usage quantities against the prepaid pool.)

[BLOCKING] What is the contractual Go-Live definition and the actual Go-Live/acceptance date for the professional services milestone? Should the go-live milestone use a specific trigger date / explicit revenue event date? (This drives both billing timing and revenue release timing for PS.)

[HIGH] Billing design decision: should drawdown usage create $0 invoice items (invoiceable) or be non-billable usage used only for prepaid depletion and revenue release? Alternatively, should it generate invoice lines that are automatically offset/applied to prepaid balance? (This impacts billing operations, invoice artifacts, and downstream integrations.)

[HIGH] Are overage and/or storage truly excluded from allocation as variable consideration for demo purposes, or should they be allocation-eligible and included in the arrangement consideration framework? (This affects SSP allocation scope and revenue disclosure outputs.)

[HIGH] Should Zuora Revenue ramp allocation/averaging across ramp periods be enabled for the 3-year arrangement, or should each annual segment remain a distinct POB/credit pool with separate allocation as currently modeled? (This changes allocated amounts and potentially recognition by year.)
[HIGH] Confirm whether Metered Storage is actually sold on this order form or is optional and should be omitted from the subscription. (This affects product catalog, invoicing, and rev rec scope.)

[MEDIUM] Discount scope: should the 10% bundle discount also apply to overage and/or storage usage rates, or are those strictly pay-as-you-go at list? (This affects invoiced amounts and could affect revenue if included in allocation scope.)

[MEDIUM] Billing timing for annual prepayments: should Year 1/2/3 be billed on each anniversary (2026-01-01, 2027-01-01, 2028-01-01) as modeled, or should all three years be billed upfront on 2026-01-01? (This affects cash, AR, and billing schedules; revenue may still be usage-driven depending on configuration.)

[MEDIUM] Discount presentation: should the 10% discount be modeled as net pricing (sellPrice < listPrice, as assumed) or as separate discount charge lines for invoice transparency? (This impacts invoice layout and some reporting.)

[DATA NEEDED] Provide committed drawdown consumption events (e.g., monthly credits consumed, and any rules about which annual pool is depleted first). (Without this, usage-driven revenue release for committed capacity cannot be illustrated beyond setup.)

[DATA NEEDED] Provide overage billing/usage events by month (usage quantities and/or invoice/bill-run dates and amounts). (Without this, monthly billed-period revenue for overage cannot be populated.)

[DATA NEEDED] Provide storage billing/usage events by month (TB-month quantities and/or invoice/bill-run dates and amounts), if storage is in-scope. (Without this, monthly billed-period revenue for storage cannot be populated.)

[NICE-TO-KNOW] For the committed capacity lines treated as consumption-driven/VC templates, what is the intended constrained estimate methodology and any expected true-ups (timing/amounts)? (This affects whether rip/replace adjustments should be modeled beyond the simplified assumption of “no VC true-ups.”)
